intro: Marrubium flavum, commonly known as the yellow horehound, is a perennial herb native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It typically grows in dry, rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. The plant features grey-green, hairy leaves and produces clusters of small, yellowish flowers. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae, which is characterized by its often hairy foliage and showy flowers. Marrubium flavum is known for its medicinal properties and has been used historically in herbal remedies.
